subject: Investing
title: Interest Rate Risk
description: A micro-lesson that makes Interest Rate Risk usable.

hook.text: You locked in 3% for 30 years. Rates jump to 6%. Your bond's market value plummets even though the issuer is fine.

buildup.text: Interest rate risk is the danger that rising rates will reduce your bond's market price before maturity.

discovery.text: Short-term bonds are less sensitive. A 2-year bond barely moves when rates shift. A 30-year bond swings wildly.

twist.text: If you hold to maturity, rate changes don't affect your final payout. The risk only matters if you sell early.

climax.text: The 2022 rate hike cycle was the fastest in 40 years. It destroyed trillions in bond value globally.

punchline.text: Interest rate risk is the bond investor's biggest enemy after inflation.

quiz.question: Which bonds are most affected by interest rate changes?
